DOC.brief_summary: Genital ureaplasmas ( Ureaplasma urealyticum Ureaplasma parvum ) genital mycoplasma ( Mycoplasma hominis Mycoplasma genitalium ) natural inhabitant male urethra contaminate semen ejaculation . However , microorganism , especially Ureaplasma urealyticum ( Uu ) Mycoplasma hominis ( Mh ) , potentially pathogenic specie play etiologic role genital infection male infertility . Despite many consentaneous opinion relationship infertility , correlation sperm regular parameter still controversially . Sperm DNA damage negatively influence fertilization rate , embryo cleavage rate , implantation rate , pregnancy live birth rate , novel indicator intrauterine insemination ( IUI ) pregnancy rate IVF ICSI pregnancy loss rate . Until , few clinical research relationship among Uu and/or Mh infection , sperm DNA damage , IUI pregnancy rate . Thus , investigator conduct prospective study investigate relationship among .
